meanings.definition: The act of introducing something into a body or cavity.
meanings.sent1: The intromission of the key into the lock was smooth and easy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor performed the intromission of the thermometer into the patient's mouth.
meanings.sent3: The intromission of the coin into the vending machine led to a delightful snack.
meanings.sent4: Her intromission of creativity into the project brought it to life.
meanings.sent5: The intromission of sunlight through the window brightened the room.

meanings.definition: The act of inserting or putting something into something else.
meanings.sent1: Careful intromission of the USB drive into the computer is important.
meanings.sent2: The intromission of the needle into the fabric required precision.
meanings.sent3: His intromission of the puzzle piece completed the picture perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The intromission of new ideas into the discussion sparked creativity.
meanings.sent5: The intromission of the key into the ignition started the car smoothly.
